This is the first of several #SeismicStories we'll be sharing in the run up to the 30th Anniversary of #LomaPrieta. Learn more about this effort here:https://twitter.com/CaltransHQ/status/1180154401568088064?s=20 …

He bravely served in the aftermath of the #1989Quake. After a full shift that day, Lichliter was commuting when the earthquake hit. He turned around and arrived at the #CypressViaduct at 8:00 p.m. The next time he looked up, 14 hours had passed. More: https://dot.ca.gov/news-releases/news-release-2019-077-special-ed-loma-prieta-30th/donald-lichliter …

With 10 days to go until the 30th anniversary of #LomaPrieta, our first #SeismicStory is also a memoriam: Today we honor the memory of Donald Lichliter. We and his loved ones lost him on July 23, 2009 when he was hit by a truck in Lodi. #RIPpic.twitter.com/6r3ZnhCiSm

63 people lost their lives. 3,757 were estimated to be injured. While the ground physically shook mainly in @CaltransD4 and @CaltransD5, a shock wave would be felt throughout California. #EarthquakeCountry had just received a wake-up call. (2/5)

5:04 p.m., October 17, 1989: #LomaPrieta shook California, physically & institutionally. This month is the 30th anniversary. To mark the occasion, we’ll be sharing some #SeismicStories from those on the ground: responding, rebuilding, and re-imagining CA and Caltrans. (1/5)pic.twitter.com/uDQoCwIzoo

Choose #TheRightSeat! In the event of a crash, even buckled up, a child is more likely to be injured or killed if they are in the front seat. Caltrans reminds motorists to drive safely in rainy conditions. Turn on your headlights and windshield wipers, turn off your cruise control, be cautious when merging into traffic, and SLOW DOWN. Slowing down reduces the risk of hydroplaning and allows for safe stops on wet roads.pic.twitter.com/Agb829rjws
